text: I didnt know this would store well! I thought anything with spring onion would go bad quickly. Maybe the oil helps with oxygen deprivation. Will smoking hot sesame oil work?

answers.text: @sotongsally hmm I wouldn't recommend it. You shouldn't heat olive oil to high temperatures generally
@lennardy OK to use olive oil? Thank you

@kin.tsu.gi yup the oil kind of forms an anaerobic barrier so that helps, plus the aromatics are basically 'cooked' with the heat of the oil. I think using 100% sesame oil would be too strong and I personally wouldn't heat up sesame oil to smoking point, I generally wouldn't heat up an oil where you want to taste the flavors, let alone to smoking point

text: Asian pesto
I also realised I made it wrongly the last time coz I cooked it over the stove instead of pouring the oil in. Thanks for the tip!

answers.text: @renztan actually I do that sometimes because I try to use minimal amount of oil so the temperature of the oil drops too much too quickly when it's added to the ginger and spring onion. If I feel that it's still too 'raw', I'll put it back in the pot and blast it on high heat for 15-30 more seconds

How do you get the egg so crispy without overcooking the egg yolk?

answers.text: @p.a.t.e.91 cook the egg whites like 70% through then slide in the yolk

text: Chicken oil is what I use for making mine 😆

answers.text: @lennardy shelf oil is the white lard? I have never seen liquid pork oil for sale in HK. It is really not that messy. The quality is too different from the shelf ones!

@little_meg_siu_meg hmm you can get just the skin/fat but i get it from a chicken supplier(you need quite a lot of chicken oil for chicken rice), I guess for the home cook you'll seldom tender chicken oil. But pork fat is far more common

@lennardy actually do they sell chicken in SG? In Hong Kong they don’t so my mom always use the chicken skin that is too fat for cooking for making chicken oil. But here you can just buy chicken skin and easy to make it
@lennardy cook some chicken and then you will have skin and can make chicken oil! 😝
@little_meg_siu_meg I think quite a few households here still tender their own pork lard but I think younger generation go with off the shelf oils, it's quite messy rendering fat 😣

@viviliciousxo I use this only for dipping chicken and for mixing with rice or noodles, so it is always with chicken fat and some chicken jus from cooking chicken. I don’t pair it with other things actually 😆
@lennardy my mom always render her own chicken oil and pork oil / liquid lard. 😊
@little_meg_siu_meg I wish I had chicken oil at home 😞
@little_meg_siu_meg @lennardy or try this with bacon fat 😍!
@lennardy I render my own too! It's actually not that messy with a bit of familiarity! Thanks for this recipe man, been looking for this for ages!

text: Looks great, going to try the hot oil thing with other herbs. Also dont you hate peeling ginger? That spoon "tip" is overrated

answers.text: @bigdaddyzenas I know what you mean lol. I actually slice off the 4 sides until I have a rough block then I use the spoon to get into the random ridges. That's the fastest way I've found so far
@lennardy yeah that's what I end up doing too, although I can't find those thicccc pieces of ginger you show in the vid🤣
